meanings.definition: Emitting smoke or having a smoky appearance.
meanings.sent1: The smokes sky made the sunset look beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The old house had a smokes chimney.
meanings.sent3: The smokes room smelled like a campfire.
meanings.sent4: The smokes fog enveloped the entire valley.
meanings.sent5: The smokes smell reminded me of a barbecue.

meanings.definition: To inhale and exhale the smoke of tobacco or a drug.
meanings.sent1: He smokes a cigarette after dinner every day.
meanings.sent2: She smokes a pipe while reading her book.
meanings.sent3: The cat looks like it wants to smokes the cigar.
meanings.sent4: The factory chimney smokes heavily all day long.
meanings.sent5: The dragon smokes from its nostrils like a chimney.

meanings.definition: To preserve or treat (food) by exposure to smoke.
meanings.sent1: They smokes the meat to give it a rich flavor.
meanings.sent2: She smokes the fish to make it last longer.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to smokes the cheese for a unique taste.
meanings.sent4: The barbecue smokes the ribs to perfection.
meanings.sent5: The smokehouse smokes the bacon for hours.

meanings.definition: To defeat or outperform someone in a competition or game.
meanings.sent1: He always smokes his opponents in chess.
meanings.sent2: She smokes the competition in every race.
meanings.sent3: The team smokes the other team in the final match.
meanings.sent4: The champion smokes all challengers effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The player smokes the high score like a pro.
